extendedIngredients.name: kosher salt
extendedIngredients.original: Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper
extendedIngredients.originalName: Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper

title: Grilled Niçoise Tuna Steaks
summary: Grilled Niçoise Tuna Steaks is a caveman, gluten free, dairy free, and primal main course. This recipe makes 10 servings with 444 calories, 53g of protein, and 22g of fat each. For $8.3 per serving, this recipe covers 41% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. 1 person has made this recipe and would make it again. If you have tuna steaks, olive oil, shallots, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. To use up the kosher salt you could follow this main course with the Low Fat Crumbs Cake (Kosher-Dairy) as a dessert. It can be enjoyed any time, but it is especially good for The Fourth Of July. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 50 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 89%. This score is super. Similar recipes include Grilled Niçoise Tuna Steaks, Grilled Tuna Niçoise, and Grilled Tuna Nicoise.

winePairing.pairingText: Tuna works really well with Merlot, Pinot Noir, and rosé Wine. Though fish is often paired with white wine, 'meatier' fish like tuna can absolutely go with red wine. A Rosé will also pair nicely, particularly if your tunan is prepared with ingredients better suited to a white wine. You could try Tinga Rio Reserve Merlot. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.8 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 12 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Tinga Rio Reserve Merlot
productMatches.description: Ruby red in color with notes of raspberries and strawberries on the nose. Sweet spices came through on the palate from the French and American oak and the palate finishes with soft round tannins. Certified Sustainable and Certified Vegan.

instructions: In a medium bowl, whisk the olive oil with the wine, mustard, thyme, fennel and shallots. Arrange the tuna steaks on a large rimmed baking sheet and pour the marinade over them. Turn the tuna steaks to coat. Let stand for 30 minutes.                                              Light a grill or preheat a grill pan. Season the tuna steaks with salt and pepper. Grill over moderately high heat, turning once, for 4 minutes per side, until medium. Thinly slice the steaks, transfer to plates and serve.

steps.step: In a medium bowl, whisk the olive oil with the wine, mustard, thyme, fennel and shallots. Arrange the tuna steaks on a large rimmed baking sheet and pour the marinade over them. Turn the tuna steaks to coat.

Light a grill or preheat a grill pan. Season the tuna steaks with salt and pepper. Grill over moderately high heat, turning once, for 4 minutes per side, until medium. Thinly slice the steaks, transfer to plates and serve.
